intro: Aphelexis sesamoides, commonly known as the common sesamoid, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Aphelexis sesamoides is typically found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun.
